comments:
N20050519-0010

When I try to create a patch for jdt.ui I always get a dialog that the resource
AddToClasspathOperation.java doesn't exist and that I should perform a refresh
from local. Doing so that not solve the problem.

It is indeed correct that AddToClasspathOperation.java doesn't exist anymore
since  the class got delete a while ago. If I add it again create patch
complains about another class which got delete a while ago.

Martin is seeing the same problem with the serialsupport.jar file.

Setting severity to critical since the behaviour prevents me from creating any
patches.
Is there anything in the error log?

Created an attachment (id=21433)
Patched CVS core plugin

Here's a patched CVS Core plugin that fixes the problem (in case you need to
generate a patch)
*** Bug 95914 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This is really a bug report for Bug 95914, but it's a dup of this so I'm putting
it here.

I continually get a "An error occurred synchronizing /projectDir: Resource
path/path/File.java is not a child of folder projectDir" error when trying to
synchronize eclipse's cvs with a windows box running CVSNT (version 2.5.01,
build 1927).

I'm using Eclipse 3.1 and this only happens with that server when it has a new
file on it that I do not yet have.  So if I try and sync with the server it
gives me that error and kills the entire synchronize leaving me with just a view
of changes I made.  I can get the sync to work again if I do an update and have
it download those files I don't have, but then I end up (at least) updating a
whole package, which I don't want to do.

When I update and get the new file(s) I then can synch up fine.

Here's the log (with paths and file names pulled out):
